00028 {
00029         if (stristr($class_name, 'amazon'))

00031                 require_once(dirname(__FILE__) . '/' . str_replace('amazon', '', strtolower($class_name)) . '.class.php');

00034         {
00035                 require_once(dirname(__FILE__) . '/' . str_replace('tarzan', '_', strtolower($class_name)) . '.class.php');
00036         }

00149         // CONSTRUCTOR
00150 
00163         public function __construct($key = null, $secret_key = null, $account_id = null, $assoc_id = null)
00164         {
00165                 // Instantiate the utilities class.
00166                 $this->util = new $this->utilities_class();
00167 
00168                 // Determine the current service.
00169                 $this->service = get_class($this);
00170 
00171                 // Set a default value for the Account ID.
00172                 if (!$account_id && defined('AWS_ACCOUNT_ID'))
00173                 {
00174                         $this->account_id = AWS_ACCOUNT_ID;
00175                 }
00176                 else // Move this to the EC2 class.
00177                 {
00178                         error_log('Tarzan: No Amazon account ID was passed into the constructor, nor was it set in the AWS_ACCOUNT_ID constant. Only required for EC2.');
00179                 }
00180 
00181                 // Set a default value for the Associates ID.
00182                 if (!$assoc_id && defined('AWS_ASSOC_ID'))
00183                 {
00184                         $this->assoc_id = AWS_ASSOC_ID;
00185                 }
00186                 else // Move this to the AAWS class.
00187                 {
00188                         error_log('Tarzan: No Amazon Associates ID was passed into the constructor, nor was it set in the AWS_ASSOC_ID constant. Only required for AAWS.');
00189                 }
00190 
00191                 // If both a key and secret key are passed in, use those.
00192                 if ($key && $secret_key)
00193                 {
00194                         $this->key = $key;
00195                         $this->secret_key = $secret_key;
00196                         return true;
00197                 }
00198 
00199                 // If neither are passed in, look for the constants instead.
00200                 else if (defined('AWS_KEY') && defined('AWS_SECRET_KEY'))
00201                 {
00202                         $this->key = AWS_KEY;
00203                         $this->secret_key = AWS_SECRET_KEY;
00204                         return true;
00205                 }
00206 
00207                 // Otherwise set the values to blank and return false.
00208                 else
00209                 {
00210                         $this->key = '';
00211                         $this->secret_key = '';
00212                         return false;
00213                 }
00214         }

00228         function set_utilities_class($class = 'TarzanUtilities')
00229         {
00230                 $this->utilities_class = $class;
00231                 $this->util = new $this->utilities_class();
00232         }

00244                 $this->request_class = $class;

00257                 $this->response_class = $class;

00261         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00262         // AUTHENTICATION
00263 
00278         public function authenticate($action, $opt = null, $queue_url = null, $message = null)
00279         {
00280                 // Manage the key-value pairs that are used in the query.
00281                 $query['Action'] = $action;
00282                 $query['AWSAccessKeyId'] = $this->key;
00283                 $query['SignatureVersion'] = 1;
00284                 $query['Timestamp'] = gmdate(DATE_AWS_ISO8601, time());
00285                 $query['Version'] = $this->api_version;
00286 
00287                 // Merge in any options that were passed in
00288                 if (is_array($opt))
00289                 {
00290                         $query = array_merge($query, $opt);
00291                 }
00292 
00293                 // Do a case-insensitive, natural order sort on the array keys.
00294                 uksort($query, 'strnatcasecmp');
00295 
00296                 // Create the string that needs to be hashed.
00297                 $sign_query = $this->util->to_signable_string($query);
00298 
00299                 // Hash the AWS secret key and generate a signature for the request.
00300                 $query['Signature'] = $this->util->hex_to_base64(hash_hmac('sha1', $sign_query, $this->secret_key));
00301 
00302                 // Generate the querystring from $query
00303                 $querystring = $this->util->to_query_string($query);
00304 
00305                 // Compose the request.
00306                 $request_url = $queue_url . '?' . $querystring;
00307                 $request =& new $this->request_class($request_url);
00308 
00309                 // Tweak some things if we have a message (i.e. AmazonSQS::send_message()).
00310                 if ($message)
00311                 {
00312                         $request->addHeader('Content-Type', 'text/plain');
00313                         $request->setMethod(HTTP_POST);
00314                         $request->setBody($message);
00315                 }
00316 
00317                 // If we have a "true" value for returnCurlHandle, do that instead of completing the request.
00318                 if (isset($opt['returnCurlHandle']))
00319                 {
00320                         return $request->prepRequest();
00321                 }
00322 
00323                 // Send!
00324                 $request->sendRequest();
00325 
00326                 // Prepare the response.
00327                 $headers = $request->getResponseHeader();
00328                 $headers['x-tarzan-requesturl'] = $request_url;
00329                 $headers['x-tarzan-stringtosign'] = $sign_query;
00330                 if ($message) $headers['x-tarzan-body'] = $message;
00331                 $data = new $this->response_class($headers, $request->getResponseBody(), $request->getResponseCode());
00332 
00333                 // Return!
00334                 return $data;
00335         }
